Join the ACLU of Montana for our annual Jeannette Rankin Civil Liberties Awards Reception.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Join us in Great Falls on Saturday, June 8 as we celebrate this year’s incredible Jeannette Rankin Civil Liberties Award recipients.

We are honored that Shahid Haque — a vital voice for immigrant rights in Montana and 2017 Jeannette Rankin Civil Liberties Award recipient — will join us as a special guest. RSVP today!

Jeannette Rankin Civil
Liberties Awards

Join us in honoring the 2019 civil liberties champions: Ana Suda, Mimi Hernandez and Melissa Smylie.

Saturday, June 8, 6 p.m.
Paris Gibson Square Museum of Art
1400 1st Ave. N
Great Falls, MT 59401

RSVP TODAY

This year’s honorees stood up for their own rights while trying to fix a broken justice system to protect others.

Ana Suda and Mimi Hernandez were unlawfully detained for speaking Spanish. They refused to accept an out-of-control and anti-immigrant Customs and Border Protections agency as a part of life.

Against all odds, Melissa Smylie was able to break free from Montana’s broken and counterproductive probation system. Now, she is sharing her story and advocating for change so that she can make the system better for others.

Join us on Saturday, June 8, at the Paris Gibson Square Museum of Art in Great Falls as we recognize and honor these outstanding Montanans.

The Jeannette Rankin Civil Liberties Award Reception is open to the public. We will have heavy hors d'oeuvres and a no-host bar. This event is free, although we gratefully accept donations to support the work of the ACLU of Montana.

We hope you can join us!

ACLU of Montana
